Animals would have the right to be treated with dignity and respect. This would mean that they would not be subjected to cruelty or abuse, and would be given appropriate care and treatment.
Animals would have the right to life. This would mean that they would be protected from harm and would not be subject to unnecessary suffering or death.
Animals would have the right to be free from exploitation. This would mean that they would not be used for commercial purposes, such as testing or entertainment.
Animals would have the right to education and training. This would mean that they would be able to learn and develop skills that would allow them to live fulfilling lives.
Animals would have the right to participate in decision-making processes that affect their lives. This would mean that they would be consulted on matters that impact their well-being and treatment.
